Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
ARK coworking has integrated several strategies to minimize their impact on the environment while providing high-quality services. Some of these practices include:

1. Using energy-efficient appliances and equipment with automatic sleep modes, after-hour timers, or other power-saving features.
2. Recycling paper, cardboard, and plastic materials with Islington Council.
3. Partnering with Castle Water to provide water supply in the past 12 months, estimating approximately m3 of water consumed during this period. Although there was an increase compared to the previous year, efforts were made to conserve water resources.
4. Evaluating operations to ensure efficiency and minimize waste production.
5. Encouraging employees, members, guests, and suppliers to participate in recycling initiatives.
6. Purchasing Energy Star certified equipment and appliances whenever possible.
7. Utilizing smart heaters and smart plugs to manage energy consumption and turn off electrical equipment automatically when not in use.
8. Striving to maintain a safe and healthy workplace for employees while adhering to relevant environmental legislation.

By implementing these sustainable practices, ARK coworking demonstrates its commitment to reducing its environmental footprint and promoting eco-friendliness among its members, employees, and guests.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Based on the provided text, I cannot provide a specific list of 10 events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation by ARK coworking. However, the text highlights several aspects of their mission related to sustainability and having a positive impact on the environment. These include:

1. Making their building operation more energy-efficient and sustainable.
2. Purchasing products from eco-friendly brands.
3. Supporting businesses that promote giving items a second life and sharing resources within the community.
4. Collaborating with local businesses and initiatives committed to making a difference in their neighborhood.
5. Engaging in activities that benefit the local community and environment.

While these points do not directly mention specific events or initiatives, they demonstrate ARK coworking's commitment to promoting environmental conservation and sustainability in their operations and community involvement.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:

1. Electricity usage and sources (renewable vs non-renewable)
2. Gas usage and carbon neutral status
3. Recycling efforts with paper, cardboard, and plastic materials
4. Water usage
5. Energy efficiency improvements and waste reduction programs implemented in their building
6. Environmental policies and links to external resources

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, based on the provided information, the organization has committed to various aspects of social and corporate responsibility. They are a certified B Corp since 209, which means they meet high standards of verified performance accountability and transparency across several areas such as employee benefits, charitable giving, supply chain practices, and input materials. Additionally, they are an accredited member of Social Enterprise UK, demonstrating their dedication to businesses with a social or environmental purpose. Furthermore, they participate in the Mayor's Business Climate Challenge (BCC), which supports businesses in reducing energy consumption and accelerating building decarbonization efforts in London. Lastly, the organization reports annually on their environmental impact and initiatives aimed at positively influencing their local neighborhood.

There is something really powerful about individuals giving back to their local community We want to embed ourselves in our local area so that as our local area flourishes our working community also flourishes ARK for Good is our way of giving back to our local area beyond simply the financial we want to encourage the giving of our members’ time and skills to projects Twice a year we run spARK a 3 month free membership with business coaching for businesses getting off the ground Each year a portion of our income is reserved to go to charities and organisations doing good in our area and who share our values Our community to helps us select charities to donate to In the 19th Century Charles Booth developed a ‘Poverty Map’ in colour which set out to define levels of poverty or wealth in London street by street using a colour coded system ranging from Black referring to the poorest in society up to Gold for the most privileged Ewan David Eason’s Mappa Mundi series in gold takes

taking into account the cultural needs of all members We take take steps to meet the needs of groups who share protected characteristics and encourage groups to participate in activity in which their participation is disproportionality low We also expect our suppliers to make sure that working conditions meet or exceed international labour standards There is no forced labour and employment is freely chosen The right of freedom of association is respected and encouraged by the employer Living wages are paid wages should always be enough to meet basic needs and to provide some discretionary income Workers are not pressurised to undertake overtime they do not wish to do Put in place sufficient systems to monitor and take responsibility for compliance with social policies Conduct regular assessments of their operations to identify eventual non-compliance cases Make sure that their suppliers and subcontractors ensure that workers’ conditions in their operations meet or exceed the above

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
Based on the given context, there are several products, services, and technologies mentioned or implied throughout the passage. Some of these include:

* ARK coworking's trade marks (e.g., "Site 43 'ARK coworking'" and "ARK coworking")
* Trade marks and trade names belonging to others that might appear on the Site
* Secure communication tools like encryption or VPNs (not explicitly mentioned but could be inferred)
* Google Suite apps (e.g., Gmail and Google Calendar) for communicating with users via email and calendar invites
* Mailchimp for sending newsletters and service updates
* Ubiquiti and related system troubleshooting and diagnostic tools
* Various software platforms and tools integrated into the Site, including but not limited to the Google Suite and Mailchimp

spARK is a 3 month scheme offering a fully paid coworking membership to startups entrepreneurs and freelancers making a difference  Funded by KXC a local church and charity in Kings Cross sharing our vision for local businesses in our area the purpose of the scheme is to support new and innovative local businesses that will impact and transform Kings Cross London and beyond We run spARK twice a year apply now for our next cohort ARK coworking already has an existing bursary scheme designed for members who need financial support For more info check out our join us section  Looking to support members on the spARK scheme Let us know by clicking here ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: One significant partnership related to commerce at ARK coworking is their accreditation as a certified B Corp. This designation demonstrates their commitment to meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across various aspects such as employee benefits, charitable giving, supply chain practices, and input materials. Additionally, they are part of the Mayor's Business Climate Challenge (BCC) program, which supports businesses in reducing their energy consumption and accelerating building decarbonization efforts in London. Furthermore, ARK coworking maintains connections within the Islington Sustainability Network, a community of businesses, non-profit organizations, and community groups working together to share resources and best practices around supporting each other's sustainability journeys. These partnerships emphasize ARK's dedication to fostering a collaborative working community that promotes responsible and sustainable commerce.

applications against these measures We believe a collaborative working community brings out the best in us  We hope that at the end of spARK your business has felt supported by other members in the community giving you the chance you needed to get your idea off to a good start At the end of spARK we would ask that you share back with the community what difference work in ARK has made to you and your idea You're of course welcome to join the community as a member on a coworking membership should you like to stay with us but there are no strings attached We just hope that we've made a difference in some way to your working life so that you can have the impact you're hoping to make  ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

1 New members typically contact us through our website email or through word of mouth We try to get back to applicants within the course of a week  2 We speak to new members before they join to explain our values and to understand a bit more of who they are At this stage we would give an indication as to whether we have availability for the applicant based on the number  type of memberships requested as well as consideration of the guidelines outlined below We look to support freelancers start-ups or social enterprises particularly those from our local area who might otherwise end up working in isolation and who would benefit from working in a collaborative community Typically groups applying have less than five members It's important to us that applicants understand our language of community we want to cultivate a collaborative creative environment where people can work together share ideas bond together over cups of coffee and lunch and share in the running of the space Members

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
The policy highlights several benefits for employees and participants. Some key benefits include:

1. Diversity and inclusion: The organization values diversity among its employees and strives to create an inclusive environment where different perspectives are appreciated and utilized. This fosters a sense of belonging and encourages innovation through collaboration.
2. Non-discrimination: The organization is committed to treating all employees and participants fairly without discrimination based on factors such as disability, race, gender, religion, or other personal attributes. This creates a safe and equitable workplace or community space for everyone.
3. Consultation with community members: The organization recognizes the importance of involving community members in decision-making processes, ensuring that their needs and preferences are taken into consideration when designing and delivering services.
4. Accessibility and accommodations: The organization aims to provide accessible facilities and services for individuals with disabilities, ensuring that everyone has equal opportunities to participate and benefit from the offerings.
5. Fair treatment and support: The organization promotes a culture of respect and fairness, where employees and participants feel secure in reporting any instances of harassment or discrimination. The organization also commits to providing support to those affected by such incidents.

source.content: taking into account the cultural needs of all members We take take steps to meet the needs of groups who share protected characteristics and encourage groups to participate in activity in which their participation is disproportionality low We also expect our suppliers to make sure that working conditions meet or exceed international labour standards There is no forced labour and employment is freely chosen The right of freedom of association is respected and encouraged by the employer Living wages are paid wages should always be enough to meet basic needs and to provide some discretionary income Workers are not pressurised to undertake overtime they do not wish to do Put in place sufficient systems to monitor and take responsibility for compliance with social policies Conduct regular assessments of their operations to identify eventual non-compliance cases Make sure that their suppliers and subcontractors ensure that workers’ conditions in their operations meet or exceed the above

in our people and use these differences to make us a stronger We also expect our members and suppliers to share this commitment to No employee is treated less favourably than any other on any grounds other than their ability or potential to perform their roles satisfactorily We encourage a diverse organisation in which all individuals may contribute as fully as possible Employees are deterred from participating in harassment or discriminatory behaviour We demonstrate to all staff that they can rely upon the company’s support in cases of harassment or discrimination at work Our services are welcoming and open to all members of the community regardless of their faith and religious background Our services meet the needs of the members whom we serve by ensuring we consult them wherever practicable in the spirit of partnership Where possible our workforce reflects the diverse communities we serve We consider the needs of diverse communities and develop appropriate methods to communicate

to see all people regardless of their disability gender race or religion know the value that they have and their place in community We want to treat every individual with dignity and respect – our staff members volunteers and suppliers ARK is committed to ensuring within the framework of the law that our workplaces are free from unlawful or unfair discrimination on the grounds of disability race sex pregnancy or maternity gender reassignment sexual orientation age married or civil partnership status religious or other similar philosophical belief Protected Characteristics ARK observes as far as practicable the Codes of Practice published by the Equality  Human Rights Commission and the Equality Act  We aim to be a fully inclusive employer  coworking provider where we value difference in our people and use these differences to make us a stronger We also expect our members and suppliers to share this commitment to No employee is treated less favourably than any other on any grounds

spARK is a 3 month scheme offering a fully paid coworking membership to startups entrepreneurs and freelancers making a difference  Funded by KXC a local church and charity in Kings Cross sharing our vision for local businesses in our area the purpose of the scheme is to support new and innovative local businesses that will impact and transform Kings Cross London and beyond We run spARK twice a year apply now for our next cohort ARK coworking already has an existing bursary scheme designed for members who need financial support For more info check out our join us section  Looking to support members on the spARK scheme Let us know by clicking here ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

As an affordable workspace provider in Islington we received the following from Islington Council which we’d like to share with our members We hope this is helpful and applicable to as many of you as possible - we are happy to help you where we can I am pleased to be able to tell you about Islington’s Discretionary Grants Fund which will open for application next week We have been awarded £28m by the Government They have set out guidance on priority areas but have given the council discretion over allocation for this funding We would like to invite you to apply for a grant of up to a maximum of £5 This scheme is open to small/micro businesses located in affordable and independent workspaces and operators of affordable and independent workspaces To apply businesses will need to meet the following criteria ·         Businesses that were trading on the 11th March  ·         Businesses with a significant fall in income due to the COVID-19 crisis ·         Businesses with ongoing

From the time you submit your application through to 4 January we'll arrange with you an Induction to ARK Come and meet the community and learn more about our vision Applicants will hear back from us by this date if they've been selected for the panel stage Interview with the spARK selection panel - a nice bunch of people who understand the values of ARK and will assess each application based on their merits If you're successful we'll communicate to you by this date that you've been selected with further details on joining the community Start date of spARK  You'll receive an induction to the space and will get a chance to meet some more of the community Sharing back with the community on the difference that spARK has made to your project ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

Collaboration & Partnerships.result: Amnesty International, NSPCC, Trussell Trust, ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd, Cally Traders Association, KQ (consortium), Covid Collaboration Team

source.content: Amnesty International is the world's leading human rights organisation campaigning against injustice and inequality everywhere Growing Hope King’s Cross is a charity providing free therapy for children and young people with additional needs It’s run in partnership with KXC and aims to grow Hope for every child to reach their developmental potential through the provision of free occupational therapy The NSPCC is the UK's leading children's charity preventing abuse and helping those affected to recover Mother to Mother based in Brooklyn NYC aims to empower women mothers and their families from all different backgrounds and cultures through educational programs practical skills and by providing a safe space to build friendship and community for both women and their young children The Trussell Trust runs a network of over  foodbanks which work out of more than 1 centres across the UK and provide emergency food to people referred for support ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street

is a community of businesses non-profit organisations and community groups working together to share resources and best practices around supporting each other’s sustainability journey to promote best environmental practice increase social value and transition to a Net Zero Carbon Islington We are part of the Cally Traders Association - a group of businesses coming together on Caledonian Road as part of We Are Cally who have a heart to see Caledonian Road and the Barnsbury estate have a brighter future by working with local people and other organisations to create new opportunities and improve local facilities KQ is a consortium of over  academic cultural research scientific and media organisations large and small based in King’s Cross with the aim of combining resources and sharing knowledge ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

the wider public and encourage them to support it; Minimise waste by evaluating our operations and ensuring they are as efficient as possible; Minimise energy and water use within our buildings and processes in order to conserve supplies and minimise the consumption of natural resources; Actively promote recycling both internally and amongst our members guests and suppliers ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

taking into account the cultural needs of all members We take take steps to meet the needs of groups who share protected characteristics and encourage groups to participate in activity in which their participation is disproportionality low We also expect our suppliers to make sure that working conditions meet or exceed international labour standards There is no forced labour and employment is freely chosen The right of freedom of association is respected and encouraged by the employer Living wages are paid wages should always be enough to meet basic needs and to provide some discretionary income Workers are not pressurised to undertake overtime they do not wish to do Put in place sufficient systems to monitor and take responsibility for compliance with social policies Conduct regular assessments of their operations to identify eventual non-compliance cases Make sure that their suppliers and subcontractors ensure that workers’ conditions in their operations meet or exceed the above

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: Based on the provided text, there is no mention of specific joint events, projects, or initiatives between ARK coworking and other entities such as local businesses, initiatives, or individuals. However, they do express their commitment to having a positive impact on their local neighborhood by teaming up with these entities and supporting businesses that promote giving items a second life and sharing resources within their community.

source.content: We have a vision for ARK to be a force for good in our local area to give back to the community around us and impact our neighbours for the better while trying our best to leave a smaller a footprint on our planet while we’re at it We’re working to make running our building a more energy efficient and sustainable business Purchasing from brands we love that care about people and the planet Supporting businesses that promote giving items a second life and sharing and reusing in our day-to-day operations Teaming up with local businesses and initiviates that are commited to making a difference A way for us to have a positive impact on our local neighbourhood Each year we report on what has happened in the past year in ARK; the businesses that call our space home our spARK program ARK updates and our environmental giving Read our latest report below and to just see our environmental impact click through on the links  impact  impact  impact  impact  impact  ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objective and outcome expected from these collaborations involve creating a supportive community for freelancers, businesses, non-profit organizations, and community groups to share resources, best practices, and ideas related to sustainability, environmental practices, social value, and community development. Through these collaborations, participants aim to enhance their individual and collective efforts towards achieving common goals while fostering a sense of unity and shared purpose.

source.content: applications against these measures We believe a collaborative working community brings out the best in us  We hope that at the end of spARK your business has felt supported by other members in the community giving you the chance you needed to get your idea off to a good start At the end of spARK we would ask that you share back with the community what difference work in ARK has made to you and your idea You're of course welcome to join the community as a member on a coworking membership should you like to stay with us but there are no strings attached We just hope that we've made a difference in some way to your working life so that you can have the impact you're hoping to make  ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

Our community pushes the boundaries of innovation - whatever industry our members work in ARK coworking hosts the leading entrepreneurs in their area of influence  We think people work best in community Our members can trust one-another being open with their business plans and colour palettes  open to new ideas  Ideas come about through conversation and relationship Beyond just renting a desk collaboration happens over a falafel thursday lunch a pour over coffee or simply a natter with all the other coworkers around you ARK coworking is a community where members can innovate Whether you are a freelancer a social enterprise or charity ARK coworking is a place where creativity flourishes and is celebrated Good things happen when people and businesses act in generosity  ARK runs as a more-than-profit That means charging membership only to serve our members with any surplus going to developing the community and supporting local charities   Develops genuine community for freelancers

is a community of businesses non-profit organisations and community groups working together to share resources and best practices around supporting each other’s sustainability journey to promote best environmental practice increase social value and transition to a Net Zero Carbon Islington We are part of the Cally Traders Association - a group of businesses coming together on Caledonian Road as part of We Are Cally who have a heart to see Caledonian Road and the Barnsbury estate have a brighter future by working with local people and other organisations to create new opportunities and improve local facilities KQ is a consortium of over  academic cultural research scientific and media organisations large and small based in King’s Cross with the aim of combining resources and sharing knowledge ARK coworking K X Coworking Ltd Carnegie Street London N1 9QW///admiralmakerstate About us  Join us  Our Values  Legal  Sitemap  Covid

we want to cultivate a collaborative creative environment where people can work together share ideas bond together over cups of coffee and lunch and share in the running of the space Members understand that the way we keep memberships affordable is because we run an at-cost model we don't have full time cleaners or receptionists which is why members get stuck in to keep the place clean and keep the gears of the space running It's because we want to foster an inclusive working environment that we would prefer not to have applicants in industries that support gambling pornography or weaponry or any other industry that might have a detrimental impact to more vulnerable members of the community or local area We also want to support creative industries as creatives tend to be the first people impacted from high costs of living in an expensive city When bringing new members into the community we want to be made aware of any conflicts that might exist - if we are made aware of any we will
